core.actor

core.actor#

The actor module contains the actor class as well as the actor networks.

The Actor acts as a wrapper around the actual deterministic policy network to provide action selection, distributed training support and loading utilities.

DDP is a vanilla deep deterministic policy network implementation.

PosePolicyNet implements an actor network with three output heads, one for translation control, a second for rotation control and a third for gripper control. It uses a special internal orientation representation that smoothly varies in SO(3). See On the Continuity of Rotation Representations in Neural Networks for details.

class mp_rl.core.actor.Actor(actor_net_type: str, size_s: int, size_a: int, nlayers: int, layer_width: int, noise_process: mp_rl.core.noise.NoiseProcess, lr: float, eps: float, action_clip: float = inf, grad_clip: float = inf)#

Actor class encapsulating the action selection and training process for the DDPG actor.

select_action(states: torch.Tensor) → numpy.ndarray#

Select an action for the given input states.

If in train mode, samples noise and chooses completely random actions with probability self.eps. If in evaluation mode, only clips the action to the maximum value.

Note

This function returns a numpy array instead of a torch.Tensor for compatibility with the gym environments.

Parameters

states – Input states.

Returns

A numpy array of actions.

backward_step(loss: torch.Tensor)#

Perform a backward pass with an optimizer step.

Parameters

loss – Actor network loss.

target(states: torch.Tensor) → torch.Tensor#

Compute actions with the target network and without noise.

Parameters

states – Input states.

Returns

An action tensor.

eval()#

Set the actor to eval mode without noise in the action selection.

train()#

Set the actor to train mode with noisy actions.

update_target(tau: float)#

Update the target network with a soft parameter transfer update.

Parameters

tau – Averaging fraction of the parameter update for the action network.

init_dist()#

Synchronize the actor network across MPI nodes and reload the target network.

load(path: pathlib.Path)#

Load saved network weights for the actor and take care of syncronizations.

Parameters

path – Path to the saved state dict.

class mp_rl.core.actor.DDP(size_s: int, size_a: int, nlayers: int, layer_width: int)#

Continuous action choice network for the agent.

forward(x: torch.Tensor) → torch.Tensor#

Compute the network forward pass.

Parameters

x – Input tensor.

Returns

The network output.

class mp_rl.core.actor.PosePolicyNet(size_s: int, size_a: int, nlayers: int, layer_width: int)#

Continuous action choice network for the agent.

Uses a special embedding for pose actions.

forward(x: torch.Tensor) → torch.Tensor#

Compute the network forward pass.

Parameters

x – Input tensor.

Returns

The network output.

forward_include_network_output(x: torch.Tensor) → Tuple[torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor]#

Compute the forward pass and include the input before the embedding in the output.

Useful for regularizing the tanh output of the embedding. Tanh can saturate and lead to diverent policies.

Parameters

x – Input tensor.

Returns

The network output and the network output before transforming the embedding into a

rotation matrix.

static embedding2flatmat(embedding: torch.Tensor) → torch.Tensor#

Transform a 6D rotation embedding into a proper rotation matrix from SO(3).

Parameters

embedding – A tensor of shape (…, 6) with values in [-1, 1].

Returns

A tensor of rotation matrices with shape (…, 9). Matrices are ordered such that a reshape to (3, 3) will yield the correct matrices without transposing.

static embedding2flatmat_safe(embedding: torch.Tensor) → torch.Tensor#

Transform a 6D rotation embedding into a proper rotation matrix from SO(3).

Safe, less performant version of the transformation. If b1 is the zero vector, it gets replaced by a random vector. If b2 is parallel to b1 it also gets replaces with a random vector.

Parameters

embedding – A tensor of shape (…, 6) with values in [-1, 1].

Returns

A tensor of rotation matrices with shape (…, 9). Matrices are ordered such that a reshape to (3, 3) will yield the correct matrices without transposing.
